results.title: Royal children
results.brief_description: This interesting newsreel footage gives a picture of the lives of three of the British Royal Children: His Royal Highness, the Prince of Wales, Her Royal Highness Princess Anne and the Duke of York, Prince Andrew as a young child. Includes the christening photographs of Prince Charles and Princess Anne; their trips on the Royal yacht to Malta and Gibraltar; Prince Charles at school, family and national occasions.

results.title: Royal Australian Survey Corps
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the men and women of the Australian Army Survey Corps in accurately mapping Australia and Pacific areas. Focuses on the important role of aerial photography, and the follow-up from the photographs - tracing copies and finally printing maps.
results.description: Shows the work of the men and women of the Australian Army Survey Corps in accurately mapping Australia and Pacific areas. Focuses on the important role of aerial photography, and the follow-up from the photographs - tracing copies and finally printing maps.

results.title: Royal Australian Navy 75 Years
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner and Associates, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description: Since the days of the First Fleet, Australia has been inevitably dependent on the sea - first for much needed supplies, later for trade. As Australia’s wealth was recognised and trade increased, the question of the country’s defence became more important, making the establishment of a Navy vital, and in 1911, the RAN came into being. An archival compilation narrated by Ronald Coleby.

results.title: Royal Australian Artillery
results.brief_description: The artillery man of today has accurate and efficient guns, unlike the men who manned the guns used to defend the colony of Sydney last century. This film describes the work and equipment of modern artillery-men in peace and wartime.
results.description: The artillery man of today has accurate and efficient guns, unlike the men who manned the guns used to defend the colony of Sydney last century. This film describes the work and equipment of modern artillery-men in peace and wartime.

results.title: Royal Air Force police dog training
results.creator_credit: William Weedon, British Films and William Hammond
results.brief_description: Dogs can be invaluable for guarding aeroplanes, supplies and prisoners, and realising this, the RAF set up a Police Dog Training Centre. This film shows each stage in the training of one of these dogs.

results.title: Roy Lichtenstein
results.creator_credit: Barrie Gavin, Julia Cave, British Broadcasting Corporation and Geoffrey Haydon
results.brief_description: Presents Roy Lichtenstein at work in his studio and indicates the sources of his inspiration and his artistic philosophies. Covers the development of his work from the sixties onwards. Photography by Fintan Sheehan. Sound by John Tellick and Tony Anscombe. Edited by Ben Morris Rostrum. Cinematography by Ken Morse.

results.title: Rowing technique
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Isaacs, Michael Johns and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rowing and Sculling”.
This is a technical film for coaches and oarsmen. The full power of the oarsman’s body must be applied to the car and the correct movement and coordination achieved to give maximum power and efficiency. The importance of even rhythm and timing is stressed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth Isaacs, Michael Johns and Dan Productions

group_siblings.title: Land training for rowing: weight lifting techniques
group_siblings.creator_credit: Elizabeth Isaacs, Michael Johns and Dan Productions

results.title: Rowing for beginners
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of rowing are described and illustrated, often in slow motion. Tub pairs and eights from Magdalen College, Oxford University, at different stages of rowing experience, are photographed in action. Their good points and their faults are indicated.
